intro: Knautia dipsacifolia subsp. arvernensis, commonly known as the Arverne knautia, is a perennial herb native to Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower heads that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky soils, preferring well-drained conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
